Package elements

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • elements.Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps the messages sent and makes the communication between sender and receiver possible. Until it reaches its full capacity server keeps all messages sent. When a user receives a message it is deleted from server and added to the inbox of the user. Gives some warnings about capacity while using.
    Author:
    Salim Kemal Tirit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(long capacity)
        Parameters:
        capacity - is the upper limit of the sum of all messages' bodies in the server.

    • Method Detail

      • checkServerLoad

        public void checkServerLoad​(java.io.PrintStream printer)
        After a user sends or receives a message current size of the server changes. So we check server load to keep things working. Uses getCurrentSize() and may change currentSize. To not to give the same warning over and over two booleans are kept: eightyPercent and fiftyPercent When server reaches %50 of its capacity a warning is printed saying "Warning! Server is %50 full." After it reaches %80 of its capacity another warning is printed saying "Warning! Server is 80% full." and if the server reaches %100 or more of its capacity it prints "Server is full. Deleting all messages..." and deletes everything in the server. If the server goes from %80 or more to between %50 to %80 percent it prints the same warning message. If it becomes less than %50 than more than %50 again it also presses the warning. To sum up if it changes its state and becomes between %50 and %80 or more than %80 a warning will be printed.
        Parameters:
        printer - makes it possible for us to print warnings to output file.

      • getCurrentSize

        public long getCurrentSize()
        Checks the size of the server every time its called and changes the currentSize according to the size.
        Returns:
        the current size of the server by the means of message body lengths.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Deletes everything from server.

      • add

        public void add​(elements.Message m)
        Adds a new message to msgs
        Parameters:
        m - is the new message to be added

      • getMsgs

        public java.util.Queue<elements.Message> getMsgs()
        Returns:
        The queue of server where we keep all messages.

      • remove

        public void remove​(elements.Message m)
        Removes a message from msgs and updates the currentSize of the server.
        Parameters:
        m - is the message to be removed.
